result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  No contact with the victims, L.B. and R.M., (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by agent and victims.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Sex Offender treatment, psychological evaluation and cognitive therapy. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Body Armor warning given  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defense brings motion to sever all counts relating to RM from all counts relating to LB. The State objects to severance and believes the counts should be tried together. Defense would like representatives of the school district to submit information. The Court will allow the filingof the documents.  The School district 118.125(f) limits the purpose of the records for the Court. Susan Fishbain, for RUSD provides a copy of the report of her evaluation of a report as received from Mr. Hayes. Regarding point #12, the State indicates the Court already denied that request as no such records exist.


BTC: The Court will allow a redacted version of the report of the female, LB. In regards to the follow up interview, it will be admissible w/o redaction and may be used in trial.. The defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waives his righ to a Miranda/Goodchild hearing. The State may use statements made by the defendant on 1/30 & 2/26 in their case in chief and in rebuttal. The State is to provide whatever she can get from the State Crime lab that is on defense list.  If some of them cannot be provided, a statement is to be provided by the State Crime Lab that these items are not available or they do not exist. The State is to turn any crime lab reports or informatoin they receive within 48 hours of receipt. A buccal swab is to be taken of RM within the next 48 hours; to be done by a law enforcement officer and be provided to Mr. Hayes. Mr. Hayes agrees that the chain of custody stops with him. Gregory Kowal will pick up the buccal swab for Mr. Hayes. Motion to dismiss is denied. Motion with respect to severance is denied. The Court has not yet determined the issue of learned treatises. The Court will make the determination if the records will be disclosed or not. #12 has been previously denied and remains so. Mr. Hayes paralegal may sit with him but she will NOT be allowed to address the Court, address a witness or present herself as a licensed attorney. She is only here to help Mr. Hayes.  Trial may be adjourned. MIL by the defense and all pretrial motions to be filed with the Court 48 hours prior to final pretrial. The Court will get an order to parties as to what is allowed and what is rejected. The Court denies the County paying for any defense experts is denied as is the motion for any other medical reports other than what the Court will review in camera. Defendant Gregory J Murry in court with attorney William J. Hayes.  Defendant Gregory J Murry in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 09-22-2015/tk
GAL Laufenberg and GAL Arnett are present. The State, as a procedural matter, indicates that they are not sure any further testimony is necessary as defense already got the records. Based on testimony previously given, the State believes that they met the threshhold for an in-camera review by this Court. Defense asks for in-camera review as well. Ms. Arnett and Ms. Laufenberg were both provided with a transcript from the previous hearing and they agree that the records should be reviewed in-camera. The State is only conceding with regards to RM. Ms. Laufenberg indicates with other records that may be requested, she is not conceding. Defense is asking for health care records for LB, HSD records and school records. The State, along with Ms. Laufenberg, do not believe the defense has met their burden regarding the HSD records. The issue brought up by Defense is redundant as Br 4 is handling the juv records with respect to disclosure/non-disclosure of HSD records. BTC: Request for defense to have access to HSD for LB or RM beyond what is already disclosed is denied. Defense makes a record that he does not have medical records for LB. Defense request for proof of counseling is summarily denied. Defense files document from Prof Psycholgy, pgs 299-306. Defense is also asking for school records for RM. The State objects as they do not feel defense has made a threshold showing under Shiffra/Green. Ms. Arnett joins the State's position. Defense does not have the actual record with him and asks for another date to continue exploring that. Defense calls Dr. Thompson - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. Defense marks Ex #1-article re: counseling for child witnesses. Cross xam by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Laufenberg. Defense marks Ex #1 as an exhibit for this hearing only. No objection/so received. Defense calls KM - DSAT. Direct by defense. Defense marks Ex #2-Release signed by witness for HSD records; Ex #3-Release signed by witness for HSD records; Ex #4-Letter from Atty office. Defense marks Ex #5 & 6: Release forms signed by JJ as witnessed by witness. Defense moves Ex 2-6 into evidence for this hearing/no obj-received. Cross xam by Ms. Laufenberg. 

The State puts argument on there record regarding defense request for school records for LB and RM and medical records for LB and objects to same. Ms. Arnett joins in the objection of the State. Ms. Laufenberg joins in the objection of the State. 

BTC: The Court will conduct an in camera review of medical records of RM. Re: therapy records that are ongoing with the victim's and possibly in the past-Under 903.03(18) Ex #1 will not be accepted as a Learned Treatise. The Court believes under 904.03 and 906.11 we are venturing into side show rather than search for truth and therefore, will not grant the right for review for in-camera with respect to mental health records and subsequent treatment records of victims. No showing has been made re: LB medical records to be reviewed in camera and therefore, that motion is denied. The Court holds open the issue of school records for both children. The State is to prepare an order  Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory J Murry in court with attorney William J. Hayes.  Defendant Gregory J Murry in custody.  Rebecca Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.  Transcript filed: 10-13-2015 vw.  Excerpted Transcript filed: 05-19-2015 vw.
Mr. Hayes indicates the issue of his continued representation of Mr. Murry is resolved. Defense withdraws Miranda/Goodchild motion as well as search warrant of the deft's home. The State advises the Court she provided a packet of disks to defense and once it was brought to her attention, she asked RPD to prepare new disks. Ms. Sommers asked RPD to provide disks to defense counsel directly as requested to ensure the disks are complete. Defense objects as to the manner the State Ms. Sommers can provide the disk to defense. On 4/10, the Court notes the State has an open record policy regarding discovery and noted that the Court told the State the disk was to be sent to Mr. Hayes.  Defense puts issues regarding discovery on the record. The State indicates they don't intend to call the child witness in question to testify and they are not subpoena'd. Defense asks the Court to order a board certified urologist to be allowed to examine defendant in the jail. Defense has already provided information to the Court that a urologist is willing to testify to the issue of potential injury to victims. The Court indictates if defense wishes to make that defense, they may. BTC: The Court will not order a urologist to examine the defendant in the jail. Defense indicates that they sent medical records to the Court 4/13. The Court notes that they received a box of medical records but they are not certified, some are not dated or stamped. Defense indicates that they would like to see current medical records of one of the victims. Defense asks for trial to be moved to October and the Court grants that request. The Defense indicates they wish to have a Schiffra Green motion. The State objects and indicates that they do not see an analysis. The Defense has Dr. Thompson here to testify. The Court is prepared to hear the Schiffra Green motion and over rules the State's objection. Defnese calls Dr. David Thompson - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. Defense marks Ex #1-CV of Dr. Thompson. Defense moves Ex #1 into evidence/received. State marks Ex #2-professional journal article. Defense marks Ex #3-IEP form of RUSD. Counsel and court reporter were called into chambers. The Court informs defendant of the proceedings that took place while in chambers. The Court indicates that the Court will appoint a GAL for both children and the defendant nor defense attorney will be billed for those charges. Shiffra Green motion will be adjourned until August. All three exhibits are received by the Court. The State asks for clarification regarding the defense's request that the State answer line by line, the defense's request regarding specific discovery. Regarding #1-7 of the notice of motion/motion, the State indicates there is no legal basis offered for any of the items requested. 

BTC: GAL to be appointed for both child victims as no cost to the defendant or defense. The Court will not order the State to go line by line regarding discovery. The Court indicates the State has 48 hours to provide discovery to defense when they receive items. The State is to mail discovery items within 48 hours. The State provides defense with police reports and will have their office billed. The Court in reviewing the DVD interviews, believes that's enough to give defense sufficient basis of time to prepare meaningful defense. Regarding certain acts #1 may be testified to, #2 is covered under the rape shield law and will not be brought up in front of the jury. The officer's arrest of the defendant was proper under 968.07(1)(d). Motion to dismiss for not having an arrest warrant is denied. Motion to dismiss amended complaint and information is denied. The filing of the amended information is granted nunc pro tunc and NG plea is entered. The Court will not allow the physical or psych eval of either victim. #6 & 7 - are subject to Shiffra Green and will be dealt with at that motion hearing. #10 & 11-Discovery may be provided by HSD to defense but that doesn't mean it can be provided to the jury. The State has until June 1 to file a response to the learned treatises. MIL will be heard at FPT on 9/29. Subpoena's for RM, LM and KL are extended based on concession of defense. Defense is to prepared order. Ruling on admissibilty of DVD's is deferred to 8/10. #21 withdrawn.  Any further information Inv. Spiegelhoff has shall be supplemented to Atty. Hayes. Ruling on specific evidence will be deferred to 8/10  Motion hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
